Author: Adam Ginsburg (keflavich) <keflavich@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-01-07 10:25:33 -0700

    fix catalog name parsing in `_args_to_payload`.  The bug was that we
    were using dict.get('key', 'default'), but if dict had {'key': None},
    None would be used instead of 'default'.  The regression test is a
    simple one but required adding get_query_payload

commit a148f6bfac188ac7b1bc2af09885e2f4c0cc9762
Author: Brigitta Sipocz <bsipocz@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-01-25 00:10:54 -0800

    Adding changelog

1	1	CHANGES

commit ae6ecd6a6c12c01732e1a1de4bfa64f0f8c45dfa
Author: Adam Ginsburg (keflavich) <keflavich@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-01-16 11:03:51 -0700

    Fix for issue 1327: HEASARC errors too aggressive
    
    In Issue #1327, the HEASARC module was returning an error even though
    the query was successful.  This problem occurred because the code is
    searching for the word "ERROR" in the returned text, and for some
    returns, "ERROR" was included in the text to mean "measurement error",
    not "query error".
    
    Keep an eye on this issue in the future, though: there may be other
    classes of HEASARC query errors we're not catching now.

2	2	astroquery/heasarc/core.py

commit f2d324e22940f100771cf3caa4e02064650092a2

commit c44266fc81a8229c3e4f7e15d0d28eca86f1e839
Author: Simon Conseil <contact@saimon.org>
Date:   2019-01-11 17:53:44 +0100

    Fix crash with beautifulsoup 4.7+
    
    beautifulsoup 4.7 switched to soupsieve for css selectors, which is
    causing a crash with the `[href$=/script]` selector. This was allowed
    before but is not standard, so soupsieve will not support it.
    
    https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/beautifulsoup/LXbShO5rL74

1	1	astroquery/eso/core.py

commit c3f825801e925f68029eb364e2176832d66ce2eb

64	51	astroquery/mpc/core.py

commit 9cd63d4b07e563516e95b158f332c0d254c424a6
Author: Michael S. P. Kelley <msk@astro.umd.edu>
Date:   2018-07-31 07:58:34 -0400

    Feature complete; all tests written; do not allow MPES formatted time strings.
    
    Do not allow MPES formatted time strings, it is too confusing.  If the
    user is unaware of the requirements, start="2000-01-01 00:30" can be
    passed and the MPES query will succeed but return some other start
    value that is close but significantly different.  The correctly
    formatted string would be "2001-01-01 0030".  Instead, parse all start
    strings through astropy's Time.
    
    Move ra/dec default formats into method.
    
    Impelement Time and Angle columns.
    
    Correct table column parsing.
    
    Simpler table column unit assignment.
    
    Test everything.

commit 295a98412dcc73ff4c9e449a94af8ff88be9b14d
Author: Matthieu Baumann <matthieu.baumann@astro.unistra.fr>
Date:   2018-07-16 17:25:36 +0200

    Add query_data_sets method
    
    This method allows to retrieve data-sets based on their meta data values.
    It does not take into account a spatial region but only a meta data expression on their values.
    Example : query_data_sets("ID=*HST*") retrieve all Hubble surveys.
    Same optional args as query_region method i.e. fields, max_rec, return_moc, max_norder...

99	37	astroquery/cds/core.py
0	65	astroquery/cds/tests/test_mocserver.py
93	0	astroquery/cds/tests/test_mocserver_remote.py

commit 7107a6bf641866488f942a63f6e5def7676794ab
Author: Matthieu Baumann <matthieu.baumann@astro.unistra.fr>
Date:   2018-07-16 15:28:46 +0200

    change mocserver_test
    
    remove mocpy.MOC.from_url calls as this method may be removed in the
    next mocpy versions. (It is the purpose of astroquery.cds to query the
    MOCServer for retrieving MOC objects, union of MOCs...). Therefore this
    feature can be removed from mocpy. If the user wants a specific MOC he
    can call query_region with ID=<name_dataset_of_moc> on all the sky (cone
    of radius 180 deg).
    
    Maybe there will be a query_dataset for retrieving table/MOCs only based
    on their meta data values.

2	2	astroquery/cds/tests/test_mocserver.py

commit 0aec115b69367d5332fe888d9149c31ea6892c7f
Author: Leo Singer <leo.singer@ligo.org>
Date:   2018-01-03 09:36:42 -0500

    Fix units in IRSA dust extinction table
    
    The IRSA dust 'extinction by band' service, queried by
    `IrsaDust.get_extinction_table()`, returns wavelength units of
    `microns` and extinction units of `mags`, which are not recognized
    by `astropy.units.Unit` because of the plural suffix. Strip off
    the plural suffix so that the units are correctly recognized.

1	0	CHANGES
4	0	astroquery/irsa_dust/core.py
5	0	astroquery/irsa_dust/tests/test_irsa_dust_remote.py

Author: Adam Ginsburg (keflavich) <keflavich@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-12-22 14:48:11 -0700

    Add the capability to resume partially-completed downloads using the
    `continuation` keyword.  Unfortunately, `continue` is the correct
    keyword (as used by wget and rsync), but it is a reserved keyword in
    python.  So far this is only applied to ESO file downloads.

Date:   2016-02-15 12:23:16 +0100

    one in a series of irregular ALMA fixes.
    (1) apparently it is possible to get a bad hit from the ALMA help page,
    incorrectly populating `_help_list`.  That breaks the whole system, so
    we double check that `_help_list` isn't empty.
    (2) Release dates can be empty.  I guess we assume that means they're
    private data sets

commit c93b4a069e32896463ec3053eeb24d94f831e600
Merge: 8375eb1c 5201b973
Author: Brigitta Sipocz <b.sipocz@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-03 11:45:18 +0000

    Merge pull request #650 from evertrol/replace-astropy.utils.ordereddict
    
    Import OrderedDict from collections instead of astropy.utils

commit 5201b973ddddf3c4f897c86bba7fe7159c1deac2
Author: Evert Rol <evert.rol@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-03 16:08:47 +1100

    Import OrderedDict from collections instead of astropy.utils
    
    astropy.utils.OrderedDict is deprecated per upcoming astropy 1.2.
    Since astroquery does not support Python 2.6 or before,
    collections.OrderedDict can be used instead.

commit db597e6f48f5ea32bd7436ecf58d354079616678
Author: hamogu <moritz.guenther@gmx.de>
Date:   2016-01-14 20:03:09 -0500

    Xmatch: allow astropy tables input iwht more than 2 columns
    
    Before this patch astropy tables as input could only have exactly
    two columns that would be exactly in the order RA, DEC. That is a bad
    design for two reasons:
    - What is the order of the columns is different.
    - After cross-matching, how do I know which object is which?
      Two RA/DEC columns are fine if I want to answer the question
      "What are the counterparts in catalog 2?" but not if I want
      to retrieve a joint catalog (e.g. I have my own optical data
      in cat1 and cross-match with 2MASS, then I want all mags in the
      returned catalog.

29	40	astroquery/xmatch/core.py
7	7	astroquery/xmatch/tests/data/posList.csv
12	12	astroquery/xmatch/tests/data/query_res.csv
6	6	astroquery/xmatch/tests/test_xmatch.py
7	6	astroquery/xmatch/tests/test_xmatch_remote.py

commit 9f5b2c003f0276eade1f9c5caf066989b61c7d9b
Author: fred3m <fred3public@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-07-14 14:08:01 -0400

    Allow users to query a list of coordinates
    
    Due to restrictions by the SDSS server it can be useful to query a list
    of coordinates in a single query. The result can then be matched with
    the original list by using:
    
    dr = coords.Angle(radius).to('degree').value
    obj_coords = coords.SkyCoord(result['ra'], result['dec'], frame='icrs',
    unit='deg')
    matches, d2d, d3d = obj_coords.match_to_catalog_sky(pos)
    result = result.group_by(matches)
    
    where the group keys are the indices to the coordinates sent to the
    query.
    
    A future modification of astroquery can do the above procedure
    automatically.

25	14	astroquery/sdss/core.py

commit e90ac8ed9d7e743a27d082986639e3448f7ab6ee
Author: Ricky Egeland <ricky.egeland@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-07-08 12:08:10 -0600

    Fix issue with extra space that breaks wildcard queries.
    
    This fixes issue #371.  Previously, for a query on "m [0-9]" the
    script line "query id wildcard  m [0-9]" would be generated, which
    returns no results from Simbad.  Now, the line
    "query id wildcard m [0-9]" is generated in the case of a wildcard,
    which works.  This hack is a quick workaround; the fragile
    _args_to_payload() function should be refactored ASAP.

1	1	astroquery/simbad/tests/test_simbad.py

commit 2663bb3322c01c502040d4e0c84f9ea5119a58d2
Author: Ricky Egeland <ricky.egeland@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-06-30 22:02:43 -0600

    Add Simbad.query_objectids(), a method to return a list of identifiers
    from Simbad as an astropy.table.Table.
    
    In the process, split SimbadResult into per-output-type subclasses,
    SimbadVOTableResult, SimbadBibcodeResult, and SimbadObjectIDs result.
    The aim is to encapsulate result output parsing functionality into
    specialized subclasses, and avoid messy if-else statements.

90	35	astroquery/simbad/core.py

    Updated astropy-helpers to latest version
    
    Fixing docs links in package test function
    
    Updated astropy-helpers to latest version.
    
    This version includes fixes for the coverage testing in affiliated packages.
    
    Use wheels for travis testing
    
    Care is taken to use a numpy wheel whose version matches the scipy/astropy wheels.
    
    Previous commit messages:
    Use development astropy for test --coverage
    Install coverage when needed
    Add cython to the travis build environment, controlled by an environmental variable
    Also added a few more words of advice to the travis part of the README
    Restore -w option to build_sphinx

    setup_package.py files

    Use MiniConda for affiliated packages
    
    Make sure condas astropy is removed before pip installing the latest developer version

    Pin Numpy version
    
    Dont use --parallel with Python 3
    
    More tidying up of .travis.yml file
    
    Move astropy dev builds earlier in .travis.yml
    
    Since they take longer, it is better to start them sooner for improved load balancing.
    
    Import astropy_helpers from inside the docs/ directory

commit 02c62a1f69e0d4a8aa212d180c6e1b67ac9e44a0
Author: Austen Groener <Austen.Groener@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-06-23 08:12:56 -0400

    Resolved conflicts in merge process.
    
    Added quite a bit to the run_sql_query(),_existing_tables(),check_query_status(),check_all_jobs(),completed_job_info(),delete_job(),and delete_all_jobs() functions, in addition to adding some preliminary docstrings for many of them.
    
    Did quite a bit more work on a number of the functions I worked on last night. Many of them are now fairly stable, with the exception of deleting jobs with the phase EXECUTING. Next should be handling the actual data stored in the tables for COMPLETED jobs.

commit 18bd24055f6dd44168590af60e2fb2e98e392bcb
Author: Erik Tollerud <erik.tollerud@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-01-05 01:22:17 -0500

    Fix headings to use "-" as second level instead of "~"
    
    Automodapi's headings have to be consistent with the rest of the page,
    so either use the =-^ sequence it uses, or use the ":headings:"
    directive of automodapi.  I did the former because it makes things
    more consistent with astropy.

commit 423db945cc0458d8afb72facbb4bfa42dad8edc8
Author: Loc Sguin-C <loicseguin@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-11-30 20:54:15 -0500

    Fix bug with `names` and first comment line
    
    When using np.genfromtxt with names=True, the first comment line is examined
    for names
    http://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/user/basics.io.genfromtxt.html#the-comments-argument
    and the first line of the SDSS returned data is a comment but does not contain
    the names, which are on the second line.

commit ef2f4bfa29a090e42e1ed55e38a8642f72198193
Author: Leo Singer <leo.singer@ligo.org>
Date:   2013-08-08 19:25:19 -0700

    Fix argument handling in irsa.Irsa.query_region
    
    * The default spatial query type (spatial='cone') was incorrectly
      capitalized (should be spatial='Cone'), so that using the default
      always caused an empty result set.
    * An 'else' clause now catches completely unrecognized spaital query
      types.
    * Coordinates are now formatted in a way that is recognized by the Gator
      service.

5	6	astroquery/irsa/core.py

Author: Brian Svoboda <bsvo@lavabit.com>
Date:   2013-05-31 21:12:00 -0700

    Remove module class LAMDAQuery for functional form
    
    The class `LAMDAQuery` was unnecessary since not messages were being
    sent from other classes and no attributes were being changed by the
    user. The methods in the class have been moved to be simple functions in
    the sub-module `lamda.core`. Some code-cleanup, de-linting, and pep8 has
    also been done.
